contentrichtext.text: {{otherships|USS Buffalo}} {|{{Infobox Ship Begin}} {{Infobox Ship Career |Ship country= |Ship flag={{USN flag|1944}} |Ship name=USS ''Buffalo'' |Ship owner= |Ship namesake=[[Buffalo, New York]] |Ship ordered= |Ship laid down=2 April 1944 |Ship builder=[[New York Shipbuilding|New York Shipbuilding Corp.]]<br>[[Camden, New Jersey]] |Ship acquired= |Ship fate= |Ship status=Construction cancelled 12 August 1944 }} {{Infobox ship characteristics | Hide header = yes | Header caption = | Ship class = {{sclass|Fargo|cruiser|0}} [[light cruiser]] | Ship displacement = | Ship length = | Ship beam = | Ship draft = | Ship propulsion = | Ship speed = | Ship range = | Ship complement = | Ship sensors = | Ship EW = | Ship armament = | Ship armor = | Ship notes = }} |} '''USS ''Buffalo'' (CL-110)''' was scheduled to be a ship in the [[United States Navy]]. She was never completed. ''Buffalo'' was laid down as a [[Fargo class cruiser|''Fargo''-class]] [[light cruiser]], 3 April 1944, by [[New York Shipbuilding Corporation]], [[Camden, New Jersey]]. With the end of [[World War II]] imminent, construction was canceled on 12 August 1945. ==References== *{{DANFS|http://www.history.navy.mil/danfs/b10/buffalo-ii.htm}} {{Fargo class cruiser}} {{US-mil-ship-stub}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Buffalo (CL-110)}} [[Category:Fargo-class cruisers]] [[Category:Ships built in New Jersey]] [[Category:World War II cruisers of the United States]] [[Category:United States Navy New York-related ships]] [[Category:United States Navy Buffalo-related ships]] [[Category:Canceled ships of the United States Navy]]
